description: Characteristic cube divisor of n: cube of g=GCD[K,F], where K is the largest square root divisor of n (A000188) and F=n/(K*K)=A007913(n) is its squarefree part; g^2 divides K^2=A008833(n)=g^2*L^2 and g divides F=gf.
comments: This is not the largest cube which divides n. It is canonical, since the decomposition n=KKgggf is unique (factors are defined above and dependent on n)
formula: a(n) = A055229(n)^3 = g^3 = ggg; n = (KK)*(ggg)*f = K^2*g^3*f = KK*a(n)^3*fMultiplicative with a(p^e)=1 for even e, a(p)=1, a(p^e)=p^3 for odd e>1. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, May 01 2002
example: If n=24, largest square divisor is 4, squarefree part is 6, g=2, a(24)=8; n=81, largest square divisor is 81, both F and g is 1, a(81)=1.
author: _Labos Elemer_, Aug 02 2000
